issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Client.InvalidManifest Error Not Returned When Image Manifest Doesn't Exist on Walrus When Running an Instance

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
After launching an instance where the NC had issues download the kernel, the instances when to terminated.  The reason stated for the instance being terminated was as follows:

{code}
<reason>USER_TERMINATED: User terminated. -- []</reason>
{code}

The error seen on the NC was as follows:

{code}
2013-09-16 16:35:48  INFO 000002639 walrus_creator           | [i-335C3E77] downloading http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Walrus/aws-image-test/initrd.img-3.2.0-53-virtual.manifest.xml
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 walrus_creator           | [i-335C3E77] failed to download component http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Walrus/aws-image-test/initrd.img-3.2.0-53-virtual.manifest.xml
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to create artifact eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f (error=1, may retry) on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 DEBUG 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to implement artifact 057|eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to provision dependency eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f for artifact eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f (error=1) on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 DEBUG 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to implement artifact 058|eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to provision dependency eri-9E2E3BDE-8d1b9e4f for artifact i-335C3E77 (error=1) on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 DEBUG 000002639 art_implement_tree       | [i-335C3E77] failed to implement artifact 054|i-335C3E77 on try 1
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 create_instance_backing  | [i-335C3E77] failed to implement backing for instance
2013-09-16 16:35:48 ERROR 000002639 startup_thread           | [i-335C3E77] failed to prepare images for instance (error=1)
{code}
fields.summary: euca-describe-instances --debug returns false reason for instance termination

comments.body: *Steps to Reproduce* * Bundle, upload and register an image that will fail to launch * Do "euca-describe-instance verbose" and see the _reason_ tag {code} $ euca-describe-instances --region LayinDaSmackDown i-335C3E77 --debug 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG DescribeInstances parsed arguments: {'userregion': 'LayinDaSmackDown', 'filters': None, 'InstanceId': ['i-335C3E77'], 'shell_configfile': '', 'deprecated_sec_key': None, 'deprecated_key_id': None, 'url': None, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None} 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config current region set to 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'ec2-url' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config section 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 INFO Config option 'ec2-url' = 'http://10.104.1.216:8773/services/Eucalyptus' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'verify-ssl' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config section 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config section '*' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 INFO Config option 'verify-ssl' not found 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config searching regions for option 'user' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config section 'LayinDaSmackDown' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 INFO Config option 'user' = 'admin' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config searching users for option 'key-id' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 DEBUG Config section 'admin' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,228 INFO Config option 'key-id' = 'L4836KVYWMJCXT4T6Q6B9' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,229 DEBUG Config searching users for option 'secret-key' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,229 DEBUG Config section 'admin' 2013-09-16 16:38:57,229 INFO Config option 'secret-key' = 2013-09-16 16:38:57,232 INFO DescribeInstances parameters: Maybe the proper error here would be _InvalidManifest_  or _InvalidAMIID.Unavailable_ seen in http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html#api-error-codes-table-client?

*Assessment* I was able to produce this on 3.4.2. In this test, I used an EBS-backed instance. When I launched the instance, I passed a block device mapping that created a volume, which surpassed the limit defined by the cloud property storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb. *Signs* * Launched instance with block device mapping that exceeded storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb. Reason returned in field in response from euca-describe-instances --debug didn't respond with [AWS error|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html] of _VolumeLimitExceeded_. Responds with the following: {code} USER_TERMINATED: User terminated. -- [] {code} * Results from testing {code} $ euca-run-instances -k account1-user01 -t m1.medium emi-2198402A --region account1-user01@ --block-device-mapping "/dev/sdb=:20" RESERVATION r-B67D3FE1 961915002812 default INSTANCE i-C48F4129 emi-2198402A euca-0-0-0-0.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
